field.label: Always cache thesaurus application results
field.comment: Set this to "No" to conditionally cache the results of user search query rewriting by active thesaurus rules. This can be used in peak trafic times to reduce the impact on your cache component with a trade-off of an increased volume of analysis requests sent to Elasticsearch/Opensearch and increased CPU usage.

field.label: Minimum amount of alternative queries
field.comment: The minimum amount of alternative queries that must be generated for a given original user search for enabling the storage of the results in the cache component. Set this to 1, for instance, to only cache the results when there is at least one alternative query generated by the thesaurus rules. Defaults to 0: cache storage is used even when there is no alternative queries through the thesaurus.

field.label: Enable stemming on synonym and expansion rules
field.comment:
If enabled, by applying the same stemming behavior that occurs when indexing product data, this will allow search queries to match synonym and expansion rules more broadly with regard to singular and plural forms of words. For instance, for a synonym rule "story,tale", searching either for "story" or "stories" will trigger the synonym and make Elasticsuite also search for "tale". For an expansion rule "sport => football,tennis,soccer,running", searching either for "sport" or "sports" will trigger the expansion and make Elasticsuite also search for "football", "tennis", "soccer" and "running".
If disabled, the legacy stricter matching mode will be applied, where searching for "stories" would not trigger a "story,tale" synonym or searching for "sports" would not trigger a "sport => football,tennis,soccer,running" expansion.
